creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
medium: Six-panel folding screen, ink, color, and gold leaf on paper
provenance: Yamanaka & Co.; Tsuchima (until 1959); John Yeon (1959-94); Richard L. Brown (1994-95); Clark Center (1995-2013)
text: This screen pictures a group of young men playing a game of kemari (similar to hacky sack) in a garden near the verandaof a house.
title: A Kemari (Japanese Football) Game Beneath Cherry Blossoms
